alert.note: Alert for Dickinson (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 3:58PM EDT until May 12 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .A slow-moving thunderstorm has brought 1 to locally 2 inches of rain over the last hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Dickinson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Norway, Vulcan, Loretto and Quinnesec. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
